t: Proverbs 3
The Rewards of Wisdom
My*pn son, do not forget my teaching, But*ln let your heart keep my commandments;
For*ln length of days and years of life And*ln peace they will add to you.
Do*ln not let kindness and truth leave you; Bind*ln them around your neck, Write*ln them on the tablet of your heart.
So*ln you will find favor and good repute In*ln the sight of God and man.
Trust*ln in the Lord*s with all your heart And*ln do not lean on your own understanding.
In*ln all your ways acknowledge Him, And*ln He will make your paths straight.
Do*ln not be wise in your own eyes; Fear*ln the Lord*s and turn away from evil.
It*ln will be healing to your body And*ln refreshment to your bones.
Honor*ln the Lord*s from your wealth And*ln from the first of all your produce;
So*ln your barns will be filled with plenty And*ln your vats will overflow with new wine.
My*ln son, do not reject the discipline of the Lord*s Or*ln loathe His reproof,
For*ln whom the Lord*s loves He reproves, Even*ln as a father corrects*i the son in whom he delights.
How*ln blessed is the man who finds wisdom And*ln the man who gains understanding.
For*ln her profit is better than the profit of silver And*ln her gain better than fine gold.
She*ln is more precious than jewels; And*ln nothing you desire compares with her.
Long*ln life is in her right hand; In*ln her left hand are riches and honor.
Her*ln ways are pleasant ways And*ln all her paths are peace.
She*ln is a tree of life to those who take hold of her, And*ln happy are all who hold her fast.
The*ln Lord*s by wisdom founded the earth, By*ln understanding He established the heavens.
By*ln His knowledge the deeps were broken up And*ln the skies drip with dew.
My*ln son, let them not vanish from your sight; Keep*ln sound wisdom and discretion,
So*ln they will be life to your soul And*ln adornment to your neck.
Then*ln you will walk in your way securely And*ln your foot will not stumble.
When*ln you lie down, you will not be afraid; When*ln you lie down, your sleep will be sweet.
Do*ln not be afraid of sudden fear Nor*ln of the onslaught of the wicked when it comes;
For*ln the Lord*s will be your confidence And*ln will keep your foot from being caught.
Do*ln not withhold good from those to whom it is due, When*ln it is in your power to do it.*i
Do*ln not say to your neighbor, “Go, and come back, And*ln tomorrow I will give it,”*i When*ln you have it with you.
Do*ln not devise harm against your neighbor, While*ln he lives securely beside you.
Do*ln not contend with a man without cause, If*ln he has done you no harm.
Do*ln not envy a man of violence And*ln do not choose any of his ways.
For*ln the devious are an abomination to the Lord;*s But*ln He is intimate with the upright.
The*ln curse of the Lord*s is on the house of the wicked, But*ln He blesses the dwelling of the righteous.
Though*ln He scoffs at the scoffers, Yet*ln He gives grace to the afflicted.
The*ln wise will inherit honor, But*ln fools display dishonor.
